Venezuela Defense of Human Rights and Civil Society Extension Act of 2016
Venezuela Defense of Human Rights and Civil Society Extension Act of 2016
A bill to extend the termination of sanctions with respect to Venezuela under the Venezuela Defense of Human Rights and Civil Society Act of 2014.
Venezuela Defense of Human Rights and Civil Society Extension Act of 2016

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Corker with an amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 445.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Ms. Ros-Lehtinen asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the Senate on April 28, 2016. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Venezuela Defense of Human Rights and Civil Society Extension Act of 2016
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Venezuela Defense of Human Rights and Civil Society Act of 2014 to extend through December 31, 2019, provisions requiring the President to impose sanctions against individuals in Venezuela who are responsible for human rights violations.
